Package javelin.controller.action

Class Action

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.action.Action
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ActionDescription
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAttack, ActionAdapter, AiMovement, AutoAttack, Breath, ConfigureBattleKeys, Defend, Dig, Examine, ExecuteManeuver, Flee, Help, Movement, PassItem, Target, UseItem, Withdraw, ZoomIn, ZoomOut
    public abstract class Action
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, ActionDescription
    One of the game moves, to be used during battle.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    AiAction, ActionMapping, Serialized Form

                                                                                     int sides)

      • perform

        public abstract boolean perform​(Combatant active)
        Performs an action as the human player.
        Parameters:
        active - Current unit.
        m - Current map.
        thing - Unit's visual representation.
        Returns:
        true if executed an action (successfully or not). Just return false if the player cannot use this action (AI-only).

      • outcome

        public static void outcome​(java.util.List<ChanceNode> list)
        Same as outcome(List, boolean) but without overrun.

      • bind

        public static float bind​(float chance)
        Emulates the fact that 1 in a d20 is always a fail and 20 is always a success.
        Returns:
        The given chance, bound to a 5%-95% range.

      • getMainKey

        public java.lang.String getMainKey()
        Specified by:
        getMainKey in interface ActionDescription
        Returns:
        Usually the first of ActionDescription.getDescriptiveKeys().

        Specified by:
        setMainKey in interface ActionDescription
        Parameters:
        key - Replaces the key given by ActionDescription.getMainKey().
